summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Apple, Inc., demanding iCloud account records associated with specific phone numbers for an investigation into alleged violations of federal law. It includes a detailed rider specifying the records required and a preservation letter instructing Apple to retain the data for 90 days.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena and preservation letter as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for Apple
events.description: Apple, Inc. was commanded to appear before the Grand Jury for the Southern District of New York to testify and produce records, though appearance could be waived if records were produced by the return date.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena and Preservation Letter
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issued a grand jury subpoena and a separate preservation letter to Apple, Inc., demanding iCloud account records and instructing the preservation of data for 90 days.

keyFacts: The subpoena targets iCloud account(s) registered to specific phone numbers, seeking extensive subscriber data, session records, payment information, and connected devices.
The investigation involves alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1001 (false statements), and 1519 (destruction, alteration, or falsification of records in federal investigations).
A preservation letter was issued under 18 U.S.C. § 2703(f)(1), directing Apple to retain all relevant account information, including data marked for deletion, for 90 days.
The document references a specific case or investigation number: Ref No. 2019R0159 (subpoena) and 2019R01059 (rider).
